thread.title: Photo: A US Coast Guard helicopter forced to make an emergency landing at a Staten Island, NY, golf course; officials say the cause was a faulty alternator - @NY1
thread.title_full: Photo: A US Coast Guard helicopter forced to make an emergency landing at a Staten Island, NY, golf course; officials say the cause was a faulty alternator - @NY1

author: Tricia McDermott
title: Photo: A US Coast Guard helicopter forced to make an emergency landing at a Staten Island, NY, golf course; officials say the cause was a faulty alternator - @NY1
text:
Coast Guard Helicopter Makes Emergency Landing on Staten Island Golf Course By NY1 NewsSunday, August 2, 2015 at 02:15 PM EDT 
A U.S. Coast Guard helicopter made an emergency landing on a golf course on Staten Island Sunday morning. 
Authorities say around 11 a.m., the pilot made an impromptu, precautionary landing onto Fairway Six of the Richmond County Country Club golf course. 
Smoke and fumes had filled the cockpit. 
Coast Guard officials say a faulty alternator was to blame. It's unclear where the helicopter was coming from. 
It later took off headed to its home base at the Atlantic City Air Station. 
No injuries were reported. ON THE AIR
